text.0: with thine assistance o thou mighty indra be it the least the midmost or the highest.
text.1: great with those aids and by these powers support us strong god in battle that subdues our foemen.
text.2: with these discomfit hosts that fight against us and check the opponents wrath thyself uninjured.
text.3: with these chase all our foes to every quarter subdue the tribes of dāsas to the Ārya.
text.4: those who array themselves as foes to smite us o indra be they kin or be they strangers.
text.5: strike thou their manly strength that it be feeble and drive in headlong flight our foemen backward.
text.6: with strength of limb the hero slays the hero when bright in arms they range them for the combat.
text.7: when two opposing hosts contend in battle for seed and offspring waters kine or cornlands.
text.8: yet no strong man hath conquered thee no hero no brave no warrior trusting in his valour.
text.9: not one of these is match for thee o indra thou far surpassest all these living creatures.
text.10: he is the lord of both these armies valour when the commanders call them to the conflict.
text.11: when with their ranks expanded they are fighting with a great foe or for a home with heroes.
text.12: and when the people stir themselves for battle be thou their saviour indra and protector.
text.13: and theirs thy manliest of our friends the pious the chiefs who have installed us priests o indra.
text.14: to thee for high dominion hath been for evermore for slaughtering the vṛtras.
text.15: all lordly power and might o holy indra given by gods for victory in battle.
text.16: so urge our hosts together in the combats yield up the godless bands that fight against us.
text.17: singing at morn may we find thee with favour yea indra and een now we bharadvājas.
